page.title: 08Houses in Easton
page.content:
Easton consists of{both old and new houses. The old houses have been there since{1934,}many of which have been pulled down. The council houses along the Dereham road were{rebuilt in {1934}and since then have been renovated on the outside. The church is one of the oldest buildings, being built around the{14th century.
Many old{coach houses, stable blocks {and barns}have been converted into modern country residences.
Here is a rencent newspaper advert: "EASTON. Older style detached bungalow offering spacious 3 bedroomed accommodation with recent double _glazing, some night storage heaters, and garden. Some updating required hence realistic price ; Â£ 30500
